decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively bringing back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard while using cheap cantrips and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burn spells, efficient creatures, and card advantage through Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes some counter spells and extra turn cards to help protect the Phoenixes and maintain tempo advantage. By combining fast threats with card advantage and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, while also utilizing card draw and tempo plays to maintain pressure on the opponent. Key cards include Fiery Impulse for removal, Picklock Prankster for additional spells, and Treasure Cruise for card advantage. The inclusion of Temporal Trespass and Hall of Storm Giants provides powerful finishers if the game goes long. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and card advantage to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of disruptive elements in the form of hand disruption and removal spells. It aims to quickly establish a board presence with evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Floodpits Drowner, while protecting them with counter spells and removal. The inclusion of powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Thousand-Faced Shadow adds additional pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Enduring Curiosity and Spyglass Siren to provide card advantage and control the opponent's resources.

This Spirit Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of spirits while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. By utilizing creatures with flash and disruptive abilities like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition, the deck can quickly apply pressure while protecting its own board state. The inclusion of cards like Portable Hole and Sheltered by Ghosts provide additional removal and protection options. With a blend of aggression and control elements, this deck aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Graveyard Trespasser. It also seeks to maintain card advantage through Castle Locthwain and Liliana of the Veil. The win condition is to control the board with creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal, while using cards like Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber and Blade of the Oni to generate additional value. The deck also has a strong mana base with cards like Mutavault and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence of flying and angel creatures to put pressure on the opponent. With cards like Bishop of Wings, Resplendent Angel, and Righteous Valkyrie, the deck aims to gain life and pump up creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Collected Company and Kayla's Reconstruction help to quickly refill the board with more threats. The deck also includes mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp into bigger threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around aggressive creature plays and maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this aggro red deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck includes a mix of efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, alongside powerful creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Bonecrusher Giant. The goal is to apply constant pressure, using cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage to boost your creatures' power. With a strong mana base and versatile creatures like Manifold Mouse, this deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.
